name: Mike Mullen
role: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff
administration: George W. Bush and Barack Obama Administrations
summary: Former Chairman of the Joint Chiefs who condemned Trump's use of military force against peaceful protesters and warned against politicizing the armed forces.

keyStatements.quote: He laid bare his disdain for the rights of peaceful protest in this country, gave succor to the leaders of other countries who take comfort in our domestic strife, and risked further politicizing the men and women of our armed forces.
keyStatements.context: Criticizing Trump's Lafayette Square photo op

keyStatements.quote: Fellow Americans are not the enemy, and must never become so.

timeline.event: Became Chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff
timeline.significance: Appointed by President George W. Bush
Served under both Bush and Obama
Broke tradition of military silence on political matters

credibility.background: Four-star admiral who served as the nation's highest-ranking military officer
positions: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (2007-2011)
